abstract: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has maintained ambiguous position during nuclear negotiations, placating moderate opposition while sending contradictory signals to hard-liners; situation is exemplified in comments from Khamenei that seemingly undermined established elements of negotiations, confusing foes and allies alike; behavior is indicative of strategy Khamenei has employed for more than decade on nuclear deal in order to keep opponents off balance.
lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s ambiguity, meant to keep the moderate opposition happy while placating the hard-liners, has been part of his strategy for more than a decade.

headline.main: Trying to Placate All, Iran Leader Zigs and Zags on Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Trying to Placate All, Iran Leader Zigs and Zags on Nuclear Talks

snippet: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei’s ambiguity, meant to keep the moderate opposition happy while placating the hard-liners, has been part of his strategy for more than a decade.
